N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 77.11 - Non-conforming facilities

State Regulations
(a) Any
facility which has a valid license or operating certificate on the effective
date of this Part, which does not meet all the requirements of this Part shall
not be relicensed or recertified unless the license or certificate holder
applies for and is granted a deferral of any requirement not met. No deferral
shall be granted unless the facility has submitted a complete and adequate site
and space utilization plan prepared in accordance with section
77.2
of this Part. (b) Deferral of requirements of the life
safety code. (1)

No applicable requirement of
the Life Safety Code 101 may be deferred for more than one year after receipt
of the request for deferral, except as approved by the commissioner to reflect
estimated time necessary to complete construction which may be
involved. (2)

Deferral may be
granted only if
(i) Compensatory devices, actions and procedures will be implemented to render the physical plant as safe
as possible during the period of deferral; and
(ii)
A plan is submitted for replacement, renovation, reconstruction, alteration or improvement which will result in
complete compliance with all applicable life safety code requirements within
the period during which deferral is granted. (c) Deferral of any other requirements not
waived as provided in this section may be granted upon submission of plans and
schedules for replacement, renovation, reconstruction, alteration or
improvement of facilities which will result in compliance with all requirements
upon completion. (d) Denial of an
application for deferral shall be made only after the applicant has been
afforded a hearing in accordance with the provisions of section 73.4 of this

Title and, if such hearing is held, on the basis of the findings of such
hearing. (e) Effect of denial of
application for deferral. In the event that an application for deferral is
denied, the facility shall have up to one year to make whatever changes in
facility operations or physical plant are necessary to comply with any
requirement of this Part not deferred. At the conclusion of this period, if the
facility is not in compliance, the commissioner, in his discretion, may revoke
the facility's operating certificate, limit the operating certificate in terms
of the kind or number of patients or residents, or allow the facility
additional time to comply. Notes
